sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"徘徊，漫游"之意。
means: roam ： 常指在广阔地方以自得其乐的愉快心情作无固定目标的漫游。
stroll ： 常指无明确目的他悠闲而缓慢地漫游。
wander ： 指无目的地到处徘徊或闲荡。
ramble ： 一般指走走停停，心情愉快，步履轻松。

sentence.Network_en: This is the best season for a ramble in the suburbs.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是去郊区漫游的最好季节.

sentence.Network_en: It would have been best written in a more concise way as it does tend to ramble.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的行文确实有些信马由缰，要是简洁一些就好了。

sentence.Network_en: By the end of May he began to ramble.
sentence.Network_cn: 到了五月底,他就开始有点东拉西扯.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 漫_百度百科 ... 漫不经心[ careless;casual;negligent] 漫步[ stroll;ramble;roam] 漫灌[ basin irrigation].
常用口语词汇27_专业词汇 ... rakish adj. 放荡的 ramble vi. 漫步，漫游 rambunctious adj. 粗暴的，难控制的，骚乱的.
英文中的叠韵近义字_百度文库 ... amble 骑马缓行 ramble 闲逛 shamble 拖沓地走.
Chicken Run_在线英语听力室 ... ) harsh a. 苛刻的 ) ramble v. 漫谈 ) be cracked up to be （口语）受到赞扬.

list.abs: they rambled on through the woods .他们漫步穿过树林。
ramble about 闲逛ramble on 继续漫步地ramble over 闲逛
rambling farm street , see building of an a residential building , office building , bazaar unplugs and case , flowers of pine , bush clusters round meantime .漫步农场街头，只见座座住宅楼、办公楼、商场楼拔地而起，青松、灌木花丛簇拥其间。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in sense 2): probably related to Middle Dutch rammelen, used of animals in the sense 'wander about on heat', also to the noun ram

encyclopedia.content: ramble是“漫步/闲逛”的意思。现代都市中有一类背着包四处游荡的人，被称为“Ramble族”。但rambleon被引申为“闲聊、神侃”。

entry.def: A ramble is a long walk in the countryside.
If you ramble, you go on a long walk in the countryside.
If you say that a person rambles in their speech or writing, you mean they do not make much sense because they keep going off the subject in a confused way.

example.ex: Sometimes she spoke sensibly; sometimes she rambled...
example.tran: 有时她讲话很有条理，有时则讲得漫无边际。

example.ex: It would have been best written in a more concise way as it does tend to ramble.
example.tran: 它的行文确实有些信马由缰，要是简洁一些就好了。

means.word_mean: 1. a leisurely walk (usually in some public place)
1. continue talking or writing in a desultory manner;
2. move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment;

sentences.sentence: "the laborers drift from one town to the next"

auth_sentence.content: Potholes is a ramble without a punch line.
auth_sentence.res_content: Potholes is a ramble without a punch line.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Potholes is a ramble without a punch line.

auth_sentence.content: You have marred my ramble, Gaffer Glover.
auth_sentence.res_content: You have marred my ramble, Gaffer Glover.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You have marred my ramble, Gaffer Glover.

auth_sentence.content: Much less satisfying is the meandering electronic ramble of Unless.
auth_sentence.res_content: Much less satisfying is the meandering electronic ramble of Unless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Much less satisfying is the meandering electronic ramble of Unless.

Sentence.sentence: Remove that resistance and you are more likely to produce a 70-page ramble (不着边际的长篇大论).

The novelist Edward St Aubyn has a narrator remark of the very rich that, "not having to consider affordability, their desires rambled on like unstoppable bores, relentless (持续不断的) and whimsical（反复无常的）at the same time.

means.word_mean: (无目的地)漫游, 漫步;(喻)漫谈, 说话东拉西扯

sentences.en: He is fond of rambling among the trees.
What is she rambling on about?
sentences.cn: 她在东拉西扯些什么呢？

sentences.en: There’s me rambling on, and you haven’t told me your news yet.
sentences.cn: 我一个劲地说，你还没有把你的事告诉我呢。

sentences.en: This is the best season for a ramble in the suburbs.
sentences.cn: 这是去郊区漫游的最好季节。
